Pixies @ E3!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2003 Topics (Year of the Counter): Pixies @ E3!
By Lisa Shock on Saturday, May 24, 2003 - 12:51 pm:

I finally found pictures of one of the MR4 events at E3, featuring live models as Pixies! Now these are all amateur photos, so they capture some odd moments, and aren't well done, but at least I found SOMETHING. (I am upset that none of the larger media sites covered this at all!)

HERE is a link to the main site, but it's a TON of pages. So I'll toss in some links to pics of interest:

Mocchi, some guy, and 3 Pixies!
Mocchi & Pixies (is that an Angel?)
3 different Pixies (is that Lilim & Mint?)
Pixie closeup
Angel & Pixie full body picture
2 Pixie closeup
clowning around
applause
flirty Pixies
here's Mocchi!

Warning: This site has some ads for porn! The ads themselves are all PG-rated, though. If your parents don't want you visiting porn sites, don't click the links!

By Monster Fenrick on Saturday, May 24, 2003 - 02:59 pm:

Man, i am happy to finally see them, but I am a little dissapointed in the Costumes themselves.. other than the wings & horns.. they really look nothing like MR pixies. (i know this must have been a really limited budget.)

I think the best pixie outfit is the black one with the dragonish wings, and the "country girl" looking pixie..at least the colors are bright, and stand out... the others are rather bland :(

ah well.. I still enjoyed checkin' them out.

By CHB on Saturday, May 24, 2003 - 03:30 pm:

One looked like a Dryad, with more green.

Of course, the costumes were somewhat of a let down, but at least they had the models at all.

Note to self: I don't consider Mocchi a model....

By Gizmo the Lemur on Saturday, May 24, 2003 - 09:25 pm:

I wonder how many Cosplay jokes can someone make with the pics? Maybe it's just me, but the girs look like they hated being Pixies (Can't blame them when they probably tell people they have SOs/bfs 20+ times during E3).

Normally I don't like "Cosplays" whether the people who dress up as fictional/historical characters consist of die hard game/anime fans, or models like Amy Weber (although seeing/imagining Amy in various Pixie outfits would be kind of...I should stop now, shouldn't I?), but I have seen worse cosplays so these aren't bad.

Thanks for posting them anyway, Lisa.
